channel.title: Sir Abdisalam | The Website
channel.description: Recent content on Sir Abdisalam | The Website

item.title: Desire and it's Nature
item.description:
"The chains of habit are too weak to be felt until they are too strong to be broken."
— Samuel Johnson

Recently, I have been thinking if my desires-good or bad-control me? Desire. It really is one of the greatest walls standing between a man and his own peace. Not all desires are evil, but the moment they become the master, the soul begins to rot. I have come to see more recently, there is something deceptive about it, the way it starts as a whisper—gentle, almost harmless. A itching for ease, for pleasure, for something just out of reach. It does not force itself upon you; it only asks. Wouldn’t it be easier? Wouldn’t it be nice? What harm is there in just this once? Or What if I just…

item.title: My 2025 Checklist
item.description:
This is the list I have laid out for myself, though I expect new ideas will arise as January unfolds. It serves as a rough outline, a gathering of thoughts and aspirations for the year ahead. My hope is that, by this time next year, these goals will stand fulfilled, each box checked with purpose.

Be conversational in Turkish
Build some Swift apps
Land new career opportunities
Read 110 Books
Bring new branches into The SISU Foundation
Revise the Quran
Get into cooking
Bring out the prototype of Journa Media
Master Web 2.0
Travel to Liechtenstein
Try to get 3.7-4.0 GPA this year
Do a Marathon run
Finish all of Fyodor Dostoevsky's work
Build more projects (at least 20)
More connections - find them if you must

Inshallah

item.title: Random Thought On The Brothers Karamazov
item.description:
Preview

  • Intro : My current thoughts on Book 1

Intro : My current thoughts on Book 1

I’m currently reading the book, and I must say, it begins at a rather slow pace—though this is, of course, typical of Fyodor’s style. Books One was excellent, revealing a deeply dysfunctional family, which I believe is entirely the result of Fyodor Pavlovich’s character.

item.title: 2024 Reflection
item.description:
2024 . What a year it was. The start of the year was epic, I had so much motivation to go do it all but as the year went by that motivation went away slowly. Which is why the quote

“Thinking is easy, acting is difficult, and to put one’s thoughts into action is the most difficult thing in the world.” – Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Really hits the head now, looking back throughout the year. I found myself casually flying through specific months, and that specific motivation I once had in January seemed more of a ghost of my thoughts. It really is easy to THINK, but to DO—this is truly what isn’t easy. But I must give myself credit; this year, I have taken lessons and wrote them down in my core memory. Also what is a year without lesson ay?

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Abdisalam Sharif Ali

Well… Welcome! I’m a lover of books-classical ones mostly-a runner at heart, and someone who’s never shy about speaking my mind. If there’s one thing you should know about me, it’s that I believe in standing up for what I think is right-and doing something about it.

I am in love with trying to bring education everywhere (pretty crazy that isn’t the case). I’m also a huge fan of the journalism industry and believe that traditional journalism is dying at the expense of money and greed (but I’ll probably go on and on about this in a blog post later).

item.title: My Books
item.description:
Note: Books with gold/blue coloring have detailed blog posts. Books marked with ** have quick thoughts. I am still working on this page :)

Philosophy

  1. The Brothers Karamazov

  2. Meditations

  3. The Metamorphosis

  4. The Judgement (Das Uretil, 1913)

Non-Fiction

  1. Atomic Habits **

    The 1% improvement principle is transformative over time. Identity-based habits are more sustainable than outcome-based ones. The four laws of behavior change provide a practical framework. Small habits compound into remarkable results.
